entry.name: ZertoAppliance_VPGs
entry.technology:
Device Properties:
zertoappliance.host -- Optional, defaults to the device IP when not set. zertoappliance.port -- Optional, defaults to 443 (Linux), set 9669 for Windows appliances. zertoappliance.user -- The user name (in the UPN or NetBIOS form as necessary), used with the Windows appliance. zertoappliance.pass -- The user password, used with the Windows appliance. zertoappliance.api.id -- The client ID, used with the Linux appliance. zertoappliance.api.key -- The client secret, used with the Linux appliance. zertoappliance.type -- Optional, forces the appliance type if required, set either "windows" or "linux". system.categories -- Add "ZertoAppliance".
Notes:
Requires access to the API endpoint on the ZVM or ZCM appliance. See the "ZertoAppliance_Token" DataSource for details.
The "RpoSlaAlert_" and "JournalSlaAlert_" datapoints can be used to alert when the SLA has been failing for the period noted in the suffix.
For example, "RpoSlaAlert_2hrs" will alert after the RPO SLA for a VPG has been failed for 2 hours.
This allows for alert noise reduction based on how long of an SLA failure can be tolerated.
A threshold (= 1) should be set in alert tuning to enable alerting.

attribute.name: scriptgroovy

datapoint.name: ActualRpoSeconds
datapoint.description: The time since the last checkpoint was written to the journal in seconds.

datapoint.name: ThroughputInMB
datapoint.description: The storage throughput for all the applications running on the VMs being protected in the VPG.

datapoint.name: ConfiguredRpoSeconds
datapoint.description: The configured SLA for the RPO in seconds.

datapoint.name: ActualHistoryMinutes
datapoint.description: The oldest checkpoint available to the journal in minutes.

datapoint.name: ProvisionedStorageInMB
datapoint.description: The storage provisioned for the VPG in the recovery site.

datapoint.name: ConfiguredHistoryMinutes
datapoint.description: The configured SLA for the Journal History in minutes.

datapoint.name: Status
datapoint.description:
The status of the VPG.
Status Codes: 0=Initializing 1=MeetingSLA 2=FailingOver 3=Moving 4=Deleting 5=Recovered 6=HistoryNotMeetingSLA 7=RpoNotMeetingSLA 8=NotMeetingSLA

datapoint.name: SubStatus
datapoint.description:
The substatus of the VPG:
Status Codes: 0=None 1=InitialSync 2=Creating 3=VolumeInitialSync 4=Sync 5=RecoveryPossible 6=DeltaSync 7=NeedsConfiguration 8=Error 9=EmptyProtectionGroup 10=DisconnectedFromPeerNoRecoveryPoints 11=FullSync 12=VolumeDeltaSync 13=VolumeFullSync 14=FailingOverCommitting 15=FailingOverBeforeCommit 16=FailingOverRollingBack 17=Promoting 18=MovingCommitting 19=MovingBeforeCommit 20=MovingRollingBack 21=Deleting 22=PendingRemove 23=BitmapSync 24=DisconnectedFromPeer 25=ReplicationPausedUserInitiated 26=ReplicationPausedSystemInitiated 27=RecoveryStorageProfileError 28=Backup 29=RollingBack 30=RecoveryStorageError 31=JournalStorageError 32=VmNotProtectedError 33=JournalOrRecoveryMissingError 34=AddedVmsInInitialSync 35=ReplicationPausedForMissingVolume 36=StoppingFotFailure 37=RollingBackFailOverLiveFailure 38=RollingBackMoveFailure 39=SplitingCommitting 40=PreparePreseed 41=JournalVmRestore

datapoint.name: UsedStorageInMB
datapoint.description: The storage used by the VPG in the recovery site.

datapoint.name: JournalSlaAlert_12hrs
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VPG ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is failing the configured Journal History SLA. This could mean recovery points expected to be available during disaster recovery have been lost.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
Journal History SLA failure, excludes empty VPGs.
0=Within SLA 1=Failing SLA

datapoint.name: JournalSlaAlert_4hrs
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VPG ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is failing the configured Journal History SLA. This could mean recovery points expected to be available during disaster recovery have been lost.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
Journal History SLA failure, excludes empty VPGs.
0=Within SLA 1=Failing SLA

datapoint.name: JournalSlaAlert_6hrs
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VPG ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is failing the configured Journal History SLA. This could mean recovery points expected to be available during disaster recovery have been lost.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
Journal History SLA failure, excludes empty VPGs.
0=Within SLA 1=Failing SLA

datapoint.name: RpoSlaAlert_2hrs
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VPG ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is failing the configured Recovery Point Objective (RPO) SLA. This could mean the VPG is not available for failover during disaster recovery.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
RPO SLA failure, excludes empty VPGs.
0=Within SLA 1=Failing SLA

datapoint.name: RpoSlaAlert_4hrs
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VPG ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is failing the configured Recovery Point Objective (RPO) SLA. This could mean the VPG is not available for failover during disaster recovery.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
RPO SLA failure, excludes empty VPGs.
0=Within SLA 1=Failing SLA

datapoint.name: RpoSlaAlert_6hrs
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VPG ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is failing the configured Recovery Point Objective (RPO) SLA. This could mean the VPG is not available for failover during disaster recovery.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
RPO SLA failure, excludes empty VPGs.
0=Within SLA 1=Failing SLA

datapoint.name: VmsCount
datapoint.description: The number of VMs protected by the VPG.

datapoint.name: JournalDifference
datapoint.description: The difference between the configured Journal History and the actual Journal History in minutes.

datapoint.name: RpoDifference
datapoint.description: The difference between the configured RPO and the actual RPO in seconds.

datapoint.name: JournalSlaAlert
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VPG ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is failing the configured Journal History SLA. This could mean recovery points expected to be available during disaster recovery have been lost.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
Journal History SLA failure, excludes empty VPGs.
0=Within SLA 1=Failing SLA

datapoint.name: RpoSlaAlert
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VPG ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## is failing the configured Recovery Point Objective (RPO) SLA. This could mean the VPG is not available for failover during disaster recovery.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
RPO SLA failure, excludes empty VPGs.
0=Within SLA 1=Failing SLA
